a31d6c116d98a6d802b1b44e4929f416 (04:40): so you mean it does works ?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:40): vs typical wifi stuff being 2.4, or 802.11a's 5.1-5.8
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:41): lower frequency RF will wiggle around/through foliage and buildings better than 2.4
a31d6c116d98a6d802b1b44e4929f416 (04:42): but wich access points should u use
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:42): xNinja: theres no complete product yet, just minipci cards.  You just use the same cards on both ends of the link
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:43): 'pro' stuff doesn't usually come complete.  You buy the radios, the 'computer', the operating system, etc.
a31d6c116d98a6d802b1b44e4929f416 (04:44): but the 5. is working with 2.4 if i am not wrong but why not the src9 working also ?
a31d6c116d98a6d802b1b44e4929f416 (04:46): sorry for the bad english
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:46): the SRC and the SR9 are very seperate items
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:46): the SRC is a 2.4 and 5 ghz device
a31d6c116d98a6d802b1b44e4929f416 (04:47): aha so the sr9 is working only with 0.9 so it cant be used with devices for 2.4/5ghz
a31d6c116d98a6d802b1b44e4929f416 (04:51): so the best card for the 2.4 is the SRC 300mw right ??
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:52): depends on what kind of bus interface you want
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:52): the best 802.11b/g card I know of is the SR2, but it requires a miniPCI slot.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (04:53): if you just want something to slap in the side of a laptop, the SRC is the best that I know of.
a31d6c116d98a6d802b1b44e4929f416 (04:56): i'll check if thereis a minipci to pcmcia converter
